body.p: In addition, the Board concluded that the judgement involved in measuring the cost of items produced is not substantially different from judgements already required when applying IAS 2 and other IFRS Standards in measuring cost, in particular for assets that take a substantial period of time to get ready for their intended use (for example, measuring the cost of abnormal amounts of wasted materials and labour, allocating costs to joint products or measuring the cost of operations incidental to the construction or development of an item of property, plant and equipment).
